pull.title: gui: Display warnings as rich text
pull.body:
On master (6621be53517d69ab855cee4a5978a44d6a133ba3), warnings that contain `<hr />` HTML tag are not displayed correctly:

![Screenshot from 2020-05-06 11-30-10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/81177281-0e49fc80-8faf-11ea-8cac-8847aa517e86.png)

Fixed:

![Screenshot from 2020-05-07 07-30-48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/81255618-ca9ad580-9036-11ea-90ad-7f4d89c1880d.png)

events.body:
Should the following be adjusted too?

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/88b2652fadf6e004e751d48884ae8d4cf5c452b8/src/qt/clientmodel.cpp#L145

@vasild 
> Should the following be adjusted too?
> 
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/88b2652fadf6e004e751d48884ae8d4cf5c452b8/src/qt/clientmodel.cpp#L145

No. It is for status bar:
![Screenshot from 2020-05-06 11-32-41](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32963518/81182501-87991d80-8fb6-11ea-8b01-d6b0fd91ff3d.png)
Is there a specific way to trigger a runaway exception?

> Is there a specific way to trigger a runaway exception?

By mutating the code :)
E.g., https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/18643#issue-599952770

Concept ACK

Took a crack at an alternative and it seems reasonable to me:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/master...Empact:200506-no-html

- reworked to the minimal diff

The OP has been updated.

rename.from: gui: Drop HTML tags in exception messages
rename.to: gui: Display warnings as rich text

events.body: Reopened to update Travis CI build list.

Does simply replacing the newlines at the end with a HTML `
` fix the `` problem?

> Sorry. Mind rewording your question? Sorry if it was not clear. You're only changing the `\n` to `
`. You write in the PR description that is solves the `
` issue (display a line instead of the plaintext html tag). I wonder why adding a `
` should make it rich text. Can you explain?

@jonasschnelli > You're only changing the `\n` to `
`. You write in the PR description that is solves the `
` issue (display a line instead of the plaintext html tag). I wonder why adding a `
` should make it rich text. Can you explain? From `QMessageBox` class [docs](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qmessagebox.html#rich-text-and-the-text-format-property): > The main text and informative text properties can be either plain text or rich text. These strings are interpreted according to the setting of the text format property. The default setting is auto-text. As we do not have means to set [`Qt::RichText`](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qt.html#TextFormat-enum) instead of `Qt::AutoText` directly, replacing s/`\n`/`
`/ forces the text string to be interpreted as a rich text.

comments.body:
So we have

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/88b2652fadf6e004e751d48884ae8d4cf5c452b8/src/warnings.h#L17

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/88b2652fadf6e004e751d48884ae8d4cf5c452b8/src/warnings.cpp#L45

Would it be better to extract the `warning_separator` variable into a global constant and use it here instead of hardcoding `"<hr />"` in both places?

Even better would be to return a vector of strings instead of multiple strings concatenated to each other with `"<hr />"`, but that would be a much bigger change, I am not suggesting to do it here in this PR.

> ... a much bigger change...

That was my concern too :)

How about drop `warning_separator` and use `std::endl`?

AFAICT this `<hr />` was introduced in #7579.
